comment: There's a chance the bartender screwed up the flight
Can't say enough about this.  Expensive, but worth it.  Smooth with rich toffee and plum flavors, ending with some spice.

On the nose, scents of ripe fruit, warm caramel and mashed grapes. On the rocks, dark fruit and spice come through, with spice being more prominent as it warms, mixing with raisin and plum as it lingers.

Nose: Plum, cherry, Herbs.
Taste: pepper, floral, fruit, it's not a straight forward deal but constantly floats around changing and giving variy notes throughout.
Very good, but the Madeira finish isn’t one of my favorites
not a complex aroma like boss hog; smooth, carmely

Had this at a work outing in Chicago because hey, the “standard whistle pig” is amaze-balls, so this has to be better. Didn’t think it was possible, but wow, this version of Whistle Pig tops the previous i had.

Nose, palate, finish: all of it is so well balanced and one of my favorite whiskeys. Less spicy than a typical Rye, and incredibly smooth. Reminds me of liquid cotton candy that’s been sitting in an oak barrel.
Nice finish.  Sweet and and smooth
Great. Love the cinnamon back. One of the best
Dark fruits, buttered raisin toast, cinnamon. Can’t get enough of this one
Delicious.   So many flavors that come through - I’m still picking up stone fruit, charred cherries and raisins at the end. Great stuff...birthday gift to myself.

Bottle was opened about a year ago, at first the taste is  dominated by deep desert wine flavors. From
there things lighten up until very slowly fading into a spicy rye finish. Great balance between heavy rye mash bill and fortified wine barrels.
Smooth drink all around, the juice is worth the squeeze for this drink.  Well done gentlemen

Prefer neat

Nose: green apple, metal filings
Taste: clove?, slightly sweet with water

Initial nosing of dill pickle potato chips, opens into more raisinated flavours from the Madeira. Mouth feel is oily and full with sweet fruit blending then into a spice of clove, brown sugar and an aftertaste of botrytis influenced grape. One of the most complex rye whiskies I've ever had

SO much going on here. 
Beautiful legs that stick to the glass...
Nose has light caramel, the familiar whistle pig rye grain notes and hints from the Madeira and port barrels in the background. 
Golden raisins in there somewhere.
Smooth palate carries a lightly sweet grain front to a finish that goes back and forth between dry oakwood, toasted grains, musty barn, cacao, ripe plum, hay, toasted pecans and  brown sugar.
